DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine extra systole use predict fluid responsiveness perioperatively patient undergo pump coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery . As additional study investigate ability mini fluid challenge predict response large volume fluid .
DOC.brief_title: Predicting Fluid Responsiveness Pump Coronary Artery Bypass Graft Using Extra Systoles
DOC.detailed_description: From induction anaesthesia cardioplegia serve two fluid challenge . Before challenge collect hemodynamic data use asses two hypothesis . Fluid responsiveness ( outcome predict ) define 15 % increase stroke volume ( SV ) immediately fluid infusion initiate ( baseline ) full fluid infusion . Stroke volume derive gold-standard pulmonary artery catheter measurement cardiac output ( CO ) , standard monitoring patient ( SV = CO/heart rate ) . From subsequent offline analysis extract curve data investigate post-ectopic characteristic identify extra systole baseline period predict fluid responsiveness ( i.e . SV change ) . This analysis address primary hypothesis . Also , analyse arterial waveform relate mini fluid challenge morphologic change ( compare heart beat infusion heart beat infusion ) see transient change , e.g . systolic blood pressure , able predict fluid responsiveness . This analysis address secondary hypothesis .
DOC.criteria: Predominant sinus rhythm ( No atrial fibrillation , trigemini , 2nd 3rd degree atrioventricular block also pace present etc . ) Ejection fraction < 35 % ( Safety limit minimise risk fluid overload ) Haemodialysis ( safety precaution patient endstage kidney failure ) Pregnancy Mentally retard ( due lack capability sign inform consent )
